<math>\begin{array}{c}\text{When solving the Hamilton Operator for an atom with several electrons:}\\ 
H(\mathrm{1,2},\cdots N)=\sum _{n=1}^{N}\left(\frac{{p}_{n}^{2}}{\mathrm{2m}}-\frac{Z{\epsilon }^{2}}{{r}_{n}}\right)+\sum _{n< m}^{\mathrm{pairs}}\frac{{\epsilon }^{2}}{|{r}_{n}-{t}_{m}|}\\ 
\text{the total wave function is made up of products from single particle wave functions (here is a mathematical term).}\\ 
\Psi (r,s)={\phi }_{\mathrm{nlm}}(r){\chi }_{{m}_{s}}(s)\text{Use the Slater determinants to do this:}\\ 
\\ 
\Psi (\mathrm{1,2},\cdots N)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}}\left|\begin{array}{cccc}{\Psi }_{{k}_{1}}(1)& 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{1}}(2)& 	\cdots & 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{1}}(N)\\ 
{\Psi }_{{k}_{2}}(1)& 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{2}}(2)& 	\cdots & 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{2}}(N)\\ 
\vdots & 	\vdots & 	\ddots & 	\vdots \\ 
{\Psi }_{{k}_{N}}(1)& 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{N}}(2)& 	\cdots & 	{\Psi }_{{k}_{N}}(N)\end{array}\right|\end{array}</math>
